verses.verse: The word <S%H1697><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> which came to Jeremiah <S%H3414><s%> the prophet <S%H5030><s%> against the Nations <S%H1471><s%>;

Against Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, against the army <S%H2428><s%> of Pharaoh <S%H6549><s%>â€“necho king <S%H4428><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, which was by the river <S%H5104><s%> Euphrates <S%H6578><s%> in Carchemish <S%H3751><s%>, which Nebuchadrezzar <S%H5019><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%> struck <S%H5221><s%> in the fourth <S%H7243><s%> year <S%H8141><s%> of Jehoiakim <S%H3079><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Josiah <S%H2977><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%>.
Order <S%H6186><s%> the shield <S%H4043><s%> and hook <S%H6793><s%>, and draw near <S%H5066><s%> to battle <S%H4421><s%>.

Harness <S%H631><s%> the horses <S%H5483><s%>; and get up <S%H5927><s%>, you horsemen <S%H6571><s%>, and stand forth <S%H3320><s%> with your helmets <S%H3553><s%>; polish <S%H4838><s%> the spears <S%H7420><s%>, and put on <S%H3847><s%> the coats of mail <S%H5630><s%>.

Why have I seen <S%H7200><s%> them dismayed <S%H2844><s%> and turned <S%H5472><s%> back <S%H268><s%>? and their mighty ones <S%H1368><s%> are beaten down <S%H3807><s%>, and are fled <S%H5127><s%> apace <S%H4498><s%>, and look not back <S%H6437><s%>: for fear <S%H4032><s%> was round about <S%H5439><s%>, says <S%H5002><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%>.

Let not the swift <S%H7031><s%> flee away <S%H5127><s%>, nor the mighty man <S%H1368><s%> escape <S%H4422><s%>; they shall stumble <S%H3782><s%>, and fall <S%H5307><s%> toward the north <S%H6828><s%> by <S%H3027><s%> the river <S%H5104><s%> Euphrates <S%H6578><s%>.
Who is this that comes up <S%H5927><s%> as a flood <S%H2975><s%>, whose waters <S%H4325><s%> are moved <S%H1607><s%> as the rivers <S%H5104><s%>?

Egypt <S%H4714><s%> rises up <S%H5927><s%> like a flood <S%H2975><s%>, and his waters <S%H4325><s%> are moved <S%H1607><s%> like the rivers <S%H5104><s%>; and he says <S%H559><s%>, I will go up <S%H5927><s%>, and will cover <S%H3680><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%>; I will destroy <S%H6><s%> the city <S%H5892><s%> and the inhabitants there <S%H3427><s%>.

Come up <S%H5927><s%>, you horses <S%H5483><s%>; and rage <S%H1984><s%>, you chariots <S%H7393><s%>; and let the mighty men <S%H1368><s%> come forth <S%H3318><s%>; the Ethiopians <S%H3568><s%> and the Libyans <S%H6316><s%>, that handle <S%H8610><s%> the shield <S%H4043><s%>; and the Lydians <S%H3866><s%>, that handle <S%H8610><s%> and bend <S%H1869><s%> the bow <S%H7198><s%>.

For this is the day <S%H3117><s%> of the Lord <S%H136><s%> God <S%H3069><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%>, a day <S%H3117><s%> of vengeance <S%H5360><s%>, that he may avenge <S%H5358><s%> him of his adversaries <S%H6862><s%>: and the sword <S%H2719><s%> shall devour <S%H398><s%>, and it shall be satiated <S%H7646><s%> and made drunk <S%H7301><s%> with their blood <S%H1818><s%>: for the Lord <S%H136><s%> God <S%H3069><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> has a sacrifice <S%H2077><s%> in the north <S%H6828><s%> country <S%H776><s%> by the river <S%H5104><s%> Euphrates <S%H6578><s%>.

Go up <S%H5927><s%> into Gilead <S%H1568><s%>, and take <S%H3947><s%> balm <S%H6875><s%>, O virgin <S%H1330><s%>, the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>: in vain <S%H7723><s%> shall you use many <S%H7235><s%> medicines <S%H7499><s%>; for you shall not be cured <S%H8585><s%>.

The nations <S%H1471><s%> have heard <S%H8085><s%> of your shame <S%H7036><s%>, and your cry <S%H6682><s%> has filled <S%H4390><s%> the land <S%H776><s%>: for the mighty man <S%H1368><s%> has stumbled <S%H3782><s%> against the mighty <S%H1368><s%>, and they are fallen <S%H5307><s%> both <S%H8147><s%> together <S%H3162><s%>.

The word <S%H1697><s%> that the Lord <S%H3068><s%> spoke <S%H1696><s%> to Jeremiah <S%H3414><s%> the prophet <S%H5030><s%>, how Nebuchadrezzar <S%H5019><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%> should come <S%H935><s%> and strike <S%H5221><s%> the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>.

Declare <S%H5046><s%> in Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, and publish <S%H8085><s%> in Migdol <S%H4024><s%>, and publish <S%H8085><s%> in Noph <S%H5297><s%> and in Tahpanhes <S%H8471><s%>: say <S%H559><s%>, Stand fast <S%H3320><s%>, and prepare <S%H3559><s%> you <S%H2719><s%>; for the sword shall devour <S%H398><s%> round about you <S%H5439><s%>.
Why are your valiant <S%H47><s%> men swept away <S%H5502><s%>? they stood <S%H5975><s%> not <S%H3068><s%>, because the Lord did drive them <S%H1920><s%>.

He made many <S%H7235><s%> to fall <S%H3782><s%>, Yes <S%H376><s%>, one fell <S%H5307><s%> upon another <S%H7453><s%>: and they said <S%H559><s%>, Arise <S%H6965><s%>, and let us go again <S%H7725><s%> to our own people <S%H5971><s%>, and to the land <S%H776><s%> of our nativity <S%H4138><s%>, from <S%H6440><s%> the oppressing <S%H3238><s%> sword <S%H2719><s%>.
They did cry <S%H7121><s%> there <S%H6547><s%>, Pharaoh king <S%H4428><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> is but a noise <S%H7588><s%>; he has passed <S%H5674><s%> the time appointed <S%H4150><s%>.

As I live <S%H2416><s%>, says <S%H5002><s%> the King <S%H4428><s%>, whose name <S%H8034><s%> is the Lord <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%>, Surely as Tabor <S%H8396><s%> is among the mountains <S%H2022><s%>, and as Carmel <S%H3760><s%> by the sea <S%H3220><s%>, so shall he come <S%H935><s%>.

O you daughter <S%H1323><s%> living <S%H3427><s%> in Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, furnish <S%H6213><s%> yourself to go into captivity <S%H3627><s%>: for Noph <S%H5297><s%> shall be waste <S%H8047><s%> and desolate <S%H3341><s%> without an inhabitant <S%H3427><s%>.
Egypt <S%H4714><s%> is like a very fair <S%H3304><s%> heifer <S%H5697><s%>, but destruction <S%H7171><s%> comes <S%H935><s%>; it comes out <S%H935><s%> of the north <S%H6828><s%>.

Also her hired men <S%H7916><s%> are in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of her like fatted <S%H4770><s%> bullocks <S%H5695><s%>; for they also are turned back <S%H6437><s%>, and are fled away <S%H5127><s%> together <S%H3162><s%>: they did not stand <S%H5975><s%>, because the day <S%H3117><s%> of their calamity <S%H343><s%> was come <S%H935><s%> upon them <S%H6256><s%>, and the time of their visitation <S%H6486><s%>.

The voice <S%H6963><s%> there shall go <S%H3212><s%> like a serpent <S%H5175><s%>; for they shall march <S%H3212><s%> with a army <S%H2428><s%>, and come <S%H935><s%> against her with axes <S%H7134><s%>, as hewers <S%H2404><s%> of wood <S%H6086><s%>.

They shall cut down <S%H3772><s%> her forest <S%H3293><s%>, says <S%H5002><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, though it cannot be searched <S%H2713><s%>; because they are more <S%H7231><s%> than the grasshoppers <S%H697><s%>, and are innumerable <S%H369><s%>.

The daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> shall be confounded <S%H3001><s%>; she shall be delivered <S%H5414><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the people <S%H5971><s%> of the north <S%H6828><s%>.

The Lord <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%>, the God <S%H430><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, says <S%H559><s%>; Behold <S%H6485><s%>, I will punish the multitude <S%H527><s%> of No <S%H4996><s%>, and Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>, and Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, with their gods <S%H430><s%>, and their kings <S%H4428><s%>; even Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>, and all them that trust in him <S%H982><s%>:

And I will deliver <S%H5414><s%> them into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of those that seek <S%H1245><s%> their lives <S%H5315><s%>, and into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of Nebuchadrezzar <S%H5019><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%>, and into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of his servants <S%H5650><s%>: and afterward <S%H310><s%> it shall be inhabited <S%H7931><s%>, as in the days <S%H3117><s%> of old <S%H6924><s%>, says <S%H5002><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%>.

But fear <S%H3372><s%> not <S%H5650><s%>, O my servant Jacob <S%H3290><s%>, and be not dismayed <S%H2865><s%>, O Israel <S%H3478><s%>: for <S%H3467><s%>, behold, I will save you from afar off <S%H7350><s%>, and your seed <S%H2233><s%> from the land <S%H776><s%> of their captivity <S%H7628><s%>; and Jacob <S%H3290><s%> shall return <S%H7725><s%>, and be in rest <S%H8252><s%> and at ease <S%H7599><s%>, and none shall make him afraid <S%H2729><s%>.

Fear <S%H3372><s%> you not <S%H3290><s%>, O Jacob my servant <S%H5650><s%>, says <S%H5002><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%>: for I am with you <S%H6213><s%>; for I will make a full end <S%H3617><s%> of all the nations <S%H1471><s%> where I have driven <S%H5080><s%> you <S%H6213><s%>: but I will not make a full end <S%H3617><s%> of you <S%H3256><s%>, but correct you in measure <S%H4941><s%>; yet will I not leave you wholly <S%H5352><s%> unpunished <S%H5352><s%>.
